items.name: Black Clover
items.description: The milk-white leaves of a climbing vine that turn black when dried. If eaten: Mildly poisonous: Save Versus Doom or suffer 1 damage per Turn for the next 1d4 Turns. If smoked: Smoking dried leaves grants the ability to speak with inanimate objects for 6 Turns.

consumption_effect.description: If smoked: speak with inanimate objects for 6 Turns. If eaten: poisonous (Save vs Doom or 1 damage/Turn for 1d4 Turns)

items.name: Blushing Mandrake
items.description: Spindly, 1′-long, roughly humanoid roots, covered in wiry, purple hairs. Blushing Mandrake roots turn a bright scarlet hue within 5 minutes of being unearthed. They reek of garlicky sweat. If boiled and the resulting liquid consumed, causes physical form changes over 1d4 weeks.

consumption_effect.description: Physical form changes over 1d4 weeks

items.name: Frondhelm
items.description: A striated green and yellow moss, with a dank aroma. Each frond is tipped with a tiny, hand-like furl. If eaten: For 1d6 Turns, the subject gains an invisible, quasi-real extra hand that can be directed to manipulate small objects up to 10′ distant. It can carry and manipulate objects weighing up to 100 coins.

consumption_effect.description: Gain invisible hand to manipulate objects up to 10' away (100 coins max) for 1d6 Turns

items.name: Goatsweed
items.description: Ungainly crowns of long, rough-furred leaves that grow upon tree branches. If burned: Produces a thick, roiling smoke that smells of roast pork. All goats and related creatures within 10′ must Save Versus Doom or caper uncontrollably for 1d4 Rounds. A portion burns for 4 Rounds.

consumption_effect.description: When burned: goats within 10' Save vs Doom or caper for 1d4 Rounds

items.name: Groaning Mandrake
items.description: Hand-sized, roughly humanoid roots, with long, straggly arms and wispy fingers. Black on the outside, with rich green flesh. The roots briefly emit a plaintive groaning, when unearthed. If eaten: The subject must Save Versus Hold or transform into the last plant or creature they ate for 1d3 hours.

consumption_effect.description: Save vs Hold or transform into last plant/creature eaten for 1d3 hours

items.name: Hag's Tears
items.description: The teardrop-shaped leaves of a marsh succulent, olive green and scaly on the outside, pink and juicy on the inside. Extremely bitter. If eaten: Enhances hearing for 3d4 Turns. The subject gains a +1 bonus to Listen, but loud sounds incur a –1 Attack and Armour Class penalty for 1 Turn.

consumption_effect.description: +1 Listen for 3d4 Turns; loud sounds cause -1 Attack/AC for 1 Turn

items.name: Horridwort
items.description: A violet marsh lichen with a musty odour and an awfully bitter flavour. If smoked: An arcane spell-caster who smokes a pipe of dried Horridwort in peace (2 Turns) has a 50% chance once a day of being able to recall to memory a single spell that they cast within the last hour.

consumption_effect.description: Arcane caster: 50% chance to recall spell cast in last hour (requires 2 Turns smoking)

items.name: Knobbled Mandrake
items.description: Hand-sized, roughly humanoid roots, covered in knobbly protrusions alike to extra heads. When plucked from the earth, knobbled mandrake roots squirm gently, sigh, then go still. They have a plum-like odour and taste of dung. If eaten: A missing bodily appendage begins to regrow.

consumption_effect.description: Missing bodily appendage begins to regrow

items.name: Mind-Moss
items.description: Glistening purple moss spattered with points of scintillating light. Smells of fresh dew and tastes of elderberries. If eaten: Has the capacity to restore memories lost due to magic or old age. A subject under the effects of a curse of delusion or amnesia may Save Versus Spell to shake off the affliction.

consumption_effect.description: Restore memories lost to magic/age; Save vs Spell to cure delusion/amnesia

items.name: Oddy Sorrel
items.description: Long, lank leaves with purple spots. Taste of awfully strong vinegar. If eaten: The subject must Save Versus Doom or forget everything that occurred in the last 3d6 days.

consumption_effect.description: Save vs Doom or forget last 3d6 days

items.name: Parson's Gobble
items.description: Purple stem nodules of a lanky woodland flower. Taste at once horribly sweet and horribly bitter. If eaten: The subject's need for sleep is eradicated for 24 hours. If consumed repeatedly, causes the subject's teeth to blacken and rot.

consumption_effect.description: No need for sleep for 24 hours; repeated use causes teeth to rot

items.name: Prancing Mandrake
items.description: 1′-long roots with lanky, human-like legs and arms and bulbous heads. The roots' legs wobble and jig when unearthed, and their faces smirk and grimace. Smell of wild garlic and taste of goose fat. If eaten: Brings about a wooziness and lightness of head within 1 Turn. The subject must Save Versus Doom or fall deeply unconscious for 2d12 hours.

consumption_effect.description: Save vs Doom or fall unconscious for 2d12 hours

items.name: Rindlewort
items.description: Long, finger-like roots that scrabble at the soil when unearthed. Smell of dung and taste horribly bitter. If boiled: The roots dissolve, producing a viscous, steel-grey liquid that can be used as an ink (sufficient for 4 pages of text). Text in Rindlewort ink can only be read by the character who wrote it and optionally one other person named while writing.

consumption_effect.description: When boiled: creates ink for 4 pages readable only by writer and one named person

items.name: Sage Toe
items.description: Toe-like root nodules of a gnarled bog willow, dug up and smoke-dried. If chewed: Grants the ability to absorb written information at a greatly accelerated rate. The subject can get the gist of a book on a quick flip through (1 Turn) and can fully absorb the contents in 6 Turns. The effects last for 2d6 Turns.

consumption_effect.description: Absorb book contents in 6 Turns (gist in 1 Turn); effects last 2d6 Turns

items.name: Sclubber's Twist
items.description: A fuzzy, lilac moss that grows in the upper branches of unusually large trees (150′ tall or more). The moss has a faint, earthy odour. If chewed, it exudes a juice that tastes like cherry wine. If chewed: The subject enters a trance state for 1d6 Turns. Fairies and demi-fey experience a fantastic vision of the dawning of creation. Mortals experience a harrowing nightmare of being torn limb from limb by evil trees.

consumption_effect.description: Trance 1d6 Turns: fairies see creation vision; mortals have nightmare of evil trees

items.name: Shub Eggs
items.description: 6″ ovoid fruit sacs dangling by rubbery cords from the twisted trees of the Nagwood. Each sac contains a brain-like inner fruit in a succulent, pink jelly. When a fruit is plucked, the brain-like interior pulses gently for an hour, then goes still. If eaten: Each whole fruit consumed heals 1 Hit Point. The subject must Save Versus Doom or be cursed with a hunger for human flesh.

consumption_effect.description: Heals 1 HP per fruit; Save vs Doom or cursed with hunger for human flesh

items.name: Snogglebeard
items.description: A lichen-like moss that grows on rotting wood in long, yellow or cyan beards. Odourless and flavourless. Unpleasantly dry, chewy, and stringy to eat. If eaten: Blurs the subject's mental aura for 1d6 Turns, enabling them to read the thoughts of others within 5′. The subject's own thoughts also flow uncontrollably outwards and are perceived by all within 10′.

consumption_effect.description: Read thoughts within 5'; own thoughts broadcast within 10'; lasts 1d6 Turns

items.name: Woodpurse
items.description: Pale, pouch-like leaves of a creeping shrub. Acorns, water, or honey are sometimes found within the pouches. The leaves are odourless and have a slightly minty taste. If eaten: The subject becomes deathly pale and partially transparent for 1d6 Turns. During this time, they can physically interact with incorporeal creatures and can harm them in combat even without magic.

consumption_effect.description: Become pale/transparent; can harm incorporeal creatures without magic for 1d6 Turns

items.name: Worm-Mallow
items.description: Stringy, pink roots of a flowering shrub beloved by toads. Taste sweet and gooey. If eaten: Induces instant sobriety and has a 3-in-6 chance of negating poisons.

consumption_effect.description: Instant sobriety; 3-in-6 chance to negate poison

items.name: Writhing Mandrake
items.description: 5″ roots with stubby limbs and wolf-like heads. When unearthed, the root writhes around as if in agony. Smell of dung. If eaten: The subject must Save Versus Doom or immediately vomit the root back up. If boiled: The resulting liquid acts as a potion preventing lycanthropic transformation for 1d4 days.

consumption_effect.description: If boiled: prevents lycanthropic transformation for 1d4 days. If eaten raw: Save vs Doom or vomit
